Title: Object: Pastime in Ancient Egypt
Description: Dancers entertaining Pharaoh, two dancers in the centre, dancing to the tune played by musicians on the left, Pharaoh sitting in his throne on the right, his attendant serving him a drink; after Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema; illustration to Art Journal, April 1874, opposite p.100. Engraving and etching
Producer name: Print made by: Charles William Sharpe
Curator's comments: The original painting dated c.1863, is now in Harris Museum and Art Gallery, Preston, England.
